meanings.definition: An invasion or attack, especially a sudden or brief one.
meanings.sent1: The unexpected incursions by the enemy caught us off guard.
meanings.sent2: The incursions of the invaders were repelled by the brave defenders.
meanings.sent3: The incursions of the mischievous squirrels into the garden always lead to chaos.
meanings.sent4: The incursions of technology into our daily lives have transformed how we communicate.
meanings.sent5: The vivid memory of the incursions haunted the villagers for years to come.

meanings.definition: A hostile entrance into a territory.
meanings.sent1: The incursions of the wild animals into the village caused fear among the residents.
meanings.sent2: The military planned to counter the enemy's incursions along the border.
meanings.sent3: The incursions of the mischievous raccoons into the garbage cans were always a nuisance.
meanings.sent4: The incursions of doubt into her mind clouded her judgment.
meanings.sent5: The sudden incursions of the storm left a trail of destruction in their wake.
